intro: Sida macropoda, commonly known as the large-seeded sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. The plant features alternate, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces and produces small, pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, elongated seeds. Sida macropoda is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
